ecgmeasure module¶

class ecgmeasure.ECGMeasure(file_bool=False, argument='ecg_data.csv', threshold=0.9, thr_brady=50, thr_tachy=140, rawdata=None)¶

Bases: object

This is the main calling class __init__ sets the __hr_rawdata

acquire_avgper(averaging_period=5)¶
acquire_avgper(self, averaging_period)

Adds averaging_period attribute to self

Parameters:
  • self – instance of ECGMeasure class
  • averaging_period – period in seconds for averaging inst hr data
change_brady_threshold(brady_threshold)¶
change_brady_threshold(self, brady_threshold)

Change the threshold that indicates whether Bradycardia is detected

Parameters:
  • self – instance of ECGMeasure class
  • brady_threshold – new value that the brady threshold will be changed to

change_tachy_threshold(self, tachy_threshold)

Change the threshold that indicates whether Tachycardia is detected

Parameters:
  • self – instance of ECGMeasure class
  • tachy_threshold – new value that the tachy threshold will be changed to
change_threshold(threshold)¶
change_threshold(self, threshold)

Change the threshold that specifies a heart beat

Parameters:
  • self – instance of ECGMeasure class
  • threshold – new value that threshold will be changed to
detect_rhythm()¶
detect_rhythm(self, hr)

Detects bradycardia & tachycardia based on threshold input and writes instances to hr DataFrame

Parameters:self – instance of ECGMeasure class
detect_rhythm_avg()¶
detect_rhythm_avg(self)

Detects bradycardia & tachycardia from average data based on threshold input and writes instances to avgdata DataFrame

Parameters:self – instance of ECGMeasure class
hrdetector()¶
hrdetector(self)

Use threshold detection to specify a heart beat (QRS height) and estimate both instantaneous and hr over delta_t

Parameters:self – instance of ECGMeasure class
hrdetector_avg()¶
hrdetector_average(self)¶

Creates dataframe to contain average data and finds the average for each averaging period

Parameters:self – instance of ECGMeasure class

thresholdhr(self)

Will return a list of thresholds, as well as the number of chunks and data_chunk size
